newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgaria c.bank says main rate cut to 5.2 pct.
newsitem.headline: Bulgaria c.bank says main rate cut to 5.2 pct.

text.p: The Bulgarian National Bank (BNB) said in a statement on Thursday it cut its main interest rate to 5.2 pct monthly from 6.2 pct.
"The executive board set the monthly interest rate as of May 12 at 5.2 percent," the statement said.
The annual interest rate becomes 62.4 percent, the statement said.
The cut reflects falling yields on one- and four-week discount T-bills auctioned daily by the Finance Ministry from Friday through Thursday.

The BNB adjusts the rate weekly to the weighted average effective monthly yield on one- and four-week discount T-bills auctioned on five successive days, in line with International Monetary Fund recommendations.
Bulgaria pledged to introduce a restrictive monetary regime, known as currency board, in mid-year, under which interest rates are determined by the market.
The effective monthly yield on one-week discount T-bills has been falling from 5.69 percent at last Friday's auction to 3.65 percent at today's auction.
The effective monthly yield on four-week discount T-bills also eased gradually to 5.14 percent on Thursday from 5.62 percent on May 2.
Lower April consumer price inflation projections have also affected the rate cut. April inflation was seen between four and five percent.
